intro: Hieracium broteri, commonly known as the broteri hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in disturbed soils. It has basal leaves that are usually hairy and lance-shaped, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium broteri is a perennial species that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
